title: How to Make a Tornado Omelette

steps.headline: Beat the eggs together in a bowl.
steps.description: Whisk until smooth or until there are no strands when you lift the fork from the mix. Season the eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper for a better and more rich taste. To get a more silky texture, consider using a sieve after beating the eggs.

steps.headline: Pour a small amount of vegetable oil into the pan.
steps.description: Heat the pan at medium to high heat until it starts to get hot. You can substitute the vegetable oil by using some butter instead.

steps.headline: Pour all the egg mixture into the pan and wait.
steps.description: Wait until the egg coagulates, forms a thin but solid base and bubbles a bit. You have to time this perfectly as you can't do a whirl if you wait too long or too short.

steps.headline: Bring the egg in.
steps.description: Bring the rim of the egg from two opposite sides of the pan using chopsticks and drag the egg to the middle of the pan. When dragging the chopsticks to the middle, put them about 3 centimetres (1.2 in) apart from each other so you can turn them easily.

steps.headline: Make a whirl using the chopsticks.
steps.description: Start turning the chopsticks in a circle. As you turn, let the runny egg coagulate, then turn the egg some more. The egg will start looking like a vortex. Jiggle the pan a bit while rotating the chopsticks. You can turn the pan instead of turning your chopsticks.

steps.headline: Remove the egg before it is fully cooked.
steps.description: This will ensure that it has a slightly moist texture. The residual heat will continue cooking the egg. Season with more pepper if desired. You should serve the dish immediately. The egg is best served with rice or curry.
